titleStmt.title: On the death of that grand imposter Oliver Cromwell, who died September the 3. 1658.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for J. Williams at the Crown in S. Pauls Church-yard,

notesStmt.note: In verse - "So let him die? so to his Grave be sent?".

Annotation on Thomason copy: "ffeb: 2d 1660"; the second 1 in the imprint date has been crossed out; "This poem was printed, ye 3d day after ye Cromwell, Bradshaw, & Ireton were hanged at Tiburn. and their bodies turned into a hole under ye gallows".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
